author: Bran_don_jin
title: Yet another.
review: This is a great set and what everybody here said,I agree with. And if you can still find this set I highly recomend it. However,I would like to piont out two things... first the landing gear thing is WAYYYYYY too weak. It can't even stand on a soft surface without falling. Last of all, it is a bit heavy so theres really not too many dogfights before you want to put it down. This is a great set though and I really think you should get this.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: best rebel ship yet!
review: i have to say that i really love the other rebel ships but this outdoes them all, the accuracy of the detail is unbeatable, the moveable leg underneath is super and what can is say about the moveable wings!!! Plus the amount of minifigs you get with this outdoes almost anything i've seen, a purely brilliant set!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great Set!
review:
I was very impressed with this set, though I admit I mainly bought it for the minifigures.  However, it has its ups and downs:

Pros:

-Realism
-Cool wing design (the s-foils lock into attack position with the turn of a knob)
-Great minifigs
-Nice price-to-parts ratio
-Nifty storage compartment on the underside

Cons:

-The nose is way too long
-Small cockpit
-Landing gear is pathetically weak (but, hey, legos are the  most customizable toys out there)

All in all, a 4.8 out of 5.  However, if I were you I would save your money for one of the unreleased sets (just go to "browse" and click on "most anticipated sets"

author: lamborghiniwafflesauce
title: Mega Awesome X wing
review:
I really liked this set.When I saw the other X-wing set (the one with Yoda's hut on Dagobah) I said:
I wish it came with no other stuff.Well, the wish came true!!!...well, kinda...When I went to the LEGO store, I sighted the X-wing on the box,I bought it without second thought.When I finished building this Super-Raw-Cool-Dude's-Shiny-Spacecraft, I was suprised at the Wedge,Chewie,Han,and Leia minifigs.Now I was really pleased with my new Babe.

Things I didn't really like;When I remove Luke's helmet, he is...BALD?!?!?!?!?

author: brickbuster2409
title: what is lego doing?!!
review: the first x-wing released in the late 90's was a great set is lego trying to degrade the ship.  first it was the ugly white one that didn't even come with lightsabers now another dumb white one and to top it off it's even more expensive just b/c of a few measly characters that you could have gotten in much better sets (like leia and han in the millenium falcon).  wedge's figure has that same creepy looking smile that the figures had back then.  and after hearing a lot of people complain b/c the ship is white lego just made it white AGAIN!  i don't recommend this set even if you don't have the x-wing, it's just not worth it! TRUST ME!

author: helo_one
title: same x-wing as set 4502, but no Yoda and hut, instead you get Wedge and gang
review:
Oke, I only bought this set out of curiosity,,,I wanted to see if this X-wing was better then the one in set 4502... and it was no suprise to me it was the same. Same buildingschematics, only a few different colours here and there (for example White nose instead of grey in the 4502 set) but overall exactly the same.

Don't get me wrong, it's a fantastic model... and if you missed the 4502 set.... well 6212 is the same fighter , different pilots...
Nice touch from Lego's to make this model to "red Three", because set 4502 is "red Five"

and there is another pro to this set,,, Luke has his pilotsuite on which he lacked in set 4502.

Still a good set, but no real suprise for me

author: Darth_Shockwave
title: A great re-release of a great fighter
review:
First off I'd like to say the X-Wing is my favourite vehicle from all off Star Wars, anyway onto the review. When this set was first announced some people were apprehensive about it, but the way I saw it was, the model was a fleet builder. Simply put when the first model came out in 2004, if you wanted a fleet off them, say 5. Then you'd buy 5, but you'd also have 5 Yoda's huts too. With this set the hut is eliminated, some more figures have been added and you can change the wing designations to pretty much any number in red squadron. I like the colours off this model, I think the whites, reds and greys blend together very nicely, and reminds off the original 70's X-Wing toy. The auto wing feature is great fun, and surprises a lot off people when they see it. The only real big problem I do have withe model is, the guns in my opinion are too short. If you look at the actual prop model in the movie, you'll see that the gun tips extend just past the cockpit. It's easily fixed though.

Pros: - 
Easily customised to other X-Wings
Great update for the design of the vehicle
Auto wings
Nice beefed up look
Lots of mini-figs
Wedge Antilles
Enjoyable to build

Cons: -
The guns should be longer
Wedge should have a different style head, not just a smiley

Overall: - I really like the new re-release. The addition off extra parts for the wings is a nice touch, and unique to this model. Recommend buying this set just so you can build a fleet off X-Wings.

author: miies
title: My favorite set right now!
review:
As the title indicates, I'm pretty happy with the X-Wing. I've had it for over a month now, and I'm still admiring it when I walk past the shelve on which it stands. It's however not perfect, as few Lego sets are. I've made a few small modifications:

1) Changed the stupid coney shaped lasers to more accurate "Harry Potter Magic Wand" stick thingies. If you have four of these wands, you should stick them in the laser dishes.
2) I hated the stupid rear landing "gear" (two sloped bricks). I've created a fully working set of folding rear legs, using some old and new hinge parts.
3) Added slots in the cargo compartment to firmly hold the light saber and a hand laser gun (not included in the set, stole it from General Grievous).
4) Added red, green, white and yellow navigation lights.

But aside from these, it's really a cool model, for both displaying and playing. The box image doesn't really do it justice - it's much sleeker when viewed from a different angle. It's also pretty accurate, aside from the wingtip laser modifications I mentioned. The main feature, the wing folding mechanism, is brilliantly designed. However, you should probably not have the wings extended for a longer period, or I think the rubber bands will stretch out permanently and the folding won't work anymore. Just a warning...

Cheers!

author: Legonater
title: "Look at the size of that thing" -Wedge, gazing at the Death Star
review: This is clearly the best set ever. The wing system is brilliant, and it has some rare charecters. This is a limit editon too, making the buy better. Right now it's my red three, and the only and first X-wing in my fleet. I managed to get this for my birthday with my money when my friend couldn't get it. I love the set, and I can't say any thing more then I love it, I just love it. So bye.

author: tmdrtn
title: Very nice scale X-wing
review:
It has been many years since I have bought any lego set. but since lego started with Star Wars sets I always wanted to get back into lego building. I now I did with this X-wing. I found it at the Local Bart-Smit toystore on sale for â‚¬59.95

Display-worthy
Nice to build
"The force is strong in this one"

Cons;

now I want to build more..

author: legoguysw
title: great set!
review:
This set is great! I highly reccomend it to all original trilogy fans!
Pros:
6 rare mnifigs(leia, luke, wedge antilles, chewbacca, han and r2d2!)

you can customize it as either wedges red 3 or lukes red 5
Storage compartment
Great look
Rare pieces
Fun to build/not to many repetitive building bits/easy to build, but not to quick
Cons:

Minor cons:
Storage comparment doesnt close completely, lightsaber may fall out when being closed
Some pieces fall off quite easily
Overall A SUPERB 4 1/2 OUT OF 5!

author: Leggodt94
title: It's the same!
review: This set is exactly like the previous one except some of the color has changed. It shows no creativity what so ever. I mean there could have been a couple a new things added to this set. However, it does come with a Wedge Antilles who is pretty rare, I guess. Still it is a good set, but it really didn't have to be THAT similar to the previous design.

author: savepuffy
title: Nice Set
review: I saw this set a Toys r us and there were only 3 left and my birthday was in 1 month so I hid the set behind the shelf , my dad found the hidden set bought it and gave it to me for my birthday!  This set some really nice minifigs such as leia (Hoth) Han Solo (Hoth) Luke (Pilot)  with blue lightsaber (WITH A METALLIC HANDLE), R2-D2, chewbacca and Wedge Antilles.  The land gear tends to slip if you don't have it totally upright saddly.  The wings open really well and I like the cockpit too.  Nice compartment for R2-D2 behind the cockpit.  If you find this set try and buy it except if the Rogue Shadow is beside it then buy that.

author: legofanatic
title: Love it
review: I just got this set and it is so cool.  It is so much better than the one that came out a few years ago.  Here are the pros of this set: the lightsabre storage, 6 minifigs, cockpit controls and good wing gears.  The cons?  None!

author: David1971
title: One of the best ever Lego sets
review:
This is an extremely nice set, and generously done with five minifigs (six if you count R2D2). It's rather unusual that all these minifigs (including a lovely Leia in Hoth snow planet gear, Han Solo and Chewbacca) would be included even though there is no place for them in the vehicle.

The X-Wing is outstanding; so well designed, and very nicely done with lots of fine detail. The construction is modular -- you make the centre chunk, then the wings, then the pointy front part, and these chunks go together to make the whole. This works well and they are solidly connected.

If I was going to be negative, I note that compared to 'traditional' Lego sets this is almost *too* complex, a bit like building an Airfix model kit. But that's not fair really ... this is very good and it is clear they have put so much thought into the clever and attractive design.

Compared to other Lego sets around this price, this one is great value, it's a surprisingly large and substantial ship, and you get all those nice minifigs. Super!

author: Cole85459
title: *sniff* best... christmas... ever!
review:
My mom got me this set for Christmas 2007. She ordered it online the day I discovered it was discontinued! Anyway, on to the review.

MINIFIGS 9.5/10
Wedge-One of my favorite characters, I was disappointed when I saw his face (Hey look! My pilot friends are dead!). Its not too bad,though, and his helmet is great.
Leia- Since she and Han wear hoth clothes, I also got this set to go with the hoth base.
Han- My favorite guy! I sorta wish he had a more serious face though.
Luke- Hmm... I have two of him.
Chewie- Nice, he looks like a real wookiee.
NO ONE IS ARMED BUT LUKE!!
FIGHTER 9/10
The design is great. to people who keep complaining about the color, they were white, but had "battle damage". It is nice and easy to hold. Very swooshable. The flaws are the landing gear, the short guns, and the nose. 

FEATURES 10/10
A feature I discovered while building is that if you turn a gear on the back the wings open up, just like in the movie. Another is the R2 socket, the ability to customize it to Red Five or Red Three. 

Now the pros and cons!

Pros:
Wedge
Han
All the minifigs
design is great
sleek
Did I mention the minifigs?
swooshable
S-Foil Wings
Nice scale

Cons:
Wedge's face is a smiley
The landing gear
Guns are too short
I wish it came with Biggs

Overall 9.5/10
This is a great set for dogfights, and I am proud to say that I own it. 
GET IT IF:
You like the X-Wing
You want to add Crew to the Echo base (Then sell Luke)
You want the X-wing but not yoda's hut
You want a cheaper way to get Hoth Han and Leia
You want to make a hangar
PASS IT UP IF:
You just want a Rebel fighter (go for the Y-Wing)
You're short on cash
You just want Wedge (Buy him on ebay)
You can't find it for under $65

My favorite set! THE X_WING
Cole

author: Rgijaba
title: strange how this set looks so much like the old one... but nice!
review: this is a awsome set that isnt exacly like thw old one, ok?!?!its fun an very swooshable, and X-wings are grey, but lego did the right thing as a grey one would look ugly...anyhoo, this set comes with luke in his pilot outfit, princess liea (hoth), han solo (weres his hood?), everyones favorite wookiee: chewbacka, R2-D2 (hes cool and all, but we all have too many aretoos!), and a all-new mini figure: Wedge Antilies!i dont know why everyone likes him so much, but hes here!the X-wing was fun too build and you can swich the wing details to make it the red 3 or red 5! so, all in all, get this set if youre a star warrs fan, and even if its fun, dont get it if youre not.

author: lego12
title: This set is THE COOLEST!
review:
I got this set at a TOYS'S R US and it struck me on how cool this set looked... well anyway here are the pros:) and the cons:( .....
 
   ______________
       Pros
   ______________

1. The color of the X-Wing is an awesome color as well as an awesome ship!

2. The way the wings open is my favorite part about the set because it is so unique.

3. Their is a secret compartment for Luke Skywalker's lightsaber.

4. It comes with  Wedge Antilles, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo, Chewbacca and R2-D2 minifigures.

5. The X-Wing can become Luke Skywalker's Red Five or Wedge's Red Three X-wing!

6. The cockpit can open easily and it is really COOL!

   ______________
      Cons
   ______________

1. The landing gear sometimes slips.

2. The guns on the wings can brake and the set is delicate.


Those are the ONLY cons so the next time you see this set ANYWHERE buy it because this set is one of my FAVORITE SETS and one of the BEST sets EVER! Thanks for reading.
          Lego12

author: BoumtjeBoumtje
title: Slightly Disappointed
review:
I'll be honest, I'm not quite as impressed with this set as I thought I was going to be. When I found it on a shelf over a year after it was discontinued for 1/2 the price it was going on eBay, I was psyched. If you're a Star Wars fan / Lego fan ... then you gotta have an X-Wing Fighter.

Good Things:
- A ton of mini-figures
- Very visually appealing, looks like the real deal
- I like how you can change the markings between Luke's and Wedge's fighter

Bad Things:
- Landing gear (Front end retracts but is extremely weak. Any pressure at all and it breaks. Rear landing gear is fixed and poorly designed. They should look to set 4953 for ideas on how better to design retractable landing gear.)
- Rubber Bands (I am never in favor of using rubber bands in a set design. You're just begging for them to wear out over time .... and then what????)
- Wing open mechanism (Very, very slow to open. You turn the dial forever before the wings are fully opened. You should be able to give a pull to a lever, and have the wings pops open once again like on set 4953)
- Light saber storage (Not as cool as it sounds. The compartment is already starting to sag)

author: Zapp_Brannigan
title: Booyah!
review: This is the best x-wing ever! It comes with a lightsaber, Luke, Wedge, Han Solo, Leia, Chewie and R2-D2. I most enjoy the gear system used to open and close the wings, which is ingenious. The engines are realistic, as well as the rest of the set. The only problem is that this set is exactly like the 2004 edition, except with different colours. The price is too high, but overall great set.

author: Buckbrick
title: Wow, you get most of the minifig stars of the show!
review:
I managed to find a new set, which is my first small scale Star Wars set, as I am more into UCS models. I got this set mainly for the minifigs. It is just fantastic that at this price, you get the main stars of original Star Wars trilogy, along with Wedge Antilles, along with the X-wing as a bonus! What's interesting is that on the same day I saw another minifig-rich set, the Imperial Shuttle inspection set (7166) going at a ridiculously high price in a Lego specialty shop. SO on this note, grab this set while you can, before it goes down that same path.

As always with Lego Star Wars, it is a fun build, although a quick one. The gearing system for the wings is really ingenious and well designed. In all, this is a great set to have.

author: DARTH_BOBA12
title: "Lock S-Foils in attack position"- Wedge Antilles
review:
Probably the most famous Rebel Starfighter in the galaxy. This is my most favorite Rebel Starfighter. This ship has 4 long-range laser cannons on each wing, it also carries 2 cargo holds (one under the cockpit, one smaller one in the rear.)Here are  some Pros & Cons.

  CONs
  
  Flimsy front landing gear
  Wedge's face is a smiley(C'MON!)
  Pricey ($49.99)USA 

  I encourage you to get LEGO set any way possible.
  This set is worth every penny!
  So if ya got the money,    well, you know.

author: brick006
title: It was ok but I'de like to see some improvements
review:
First of all let me start with what's good. 
-It came with a lot of minifigs: Luke (pilot), Wedge Antilles, Leia, Han, Chewbacca, R2D2
-Wings "S-Foils" open and close
-It looks great
But i've noticed a lot of things that were off.
-It looks good but the older x-wing looks more like the one from the movie.
-The colors are off. Shouldn't it be grey instead of white. And there are colors littered everywhere almost like there was no uniformity. It reminds me of the Sandcrawler.
-With all the minifigs they gave, where's C-3P0?
-Why are the minifigs in there snow Hoth outfits instead of their basic attire?

author: yodaccm
title: A must for any Star Wars collection
review:
I was really happy when I found this set at the Lego store.  How can you not have the classic X-wing in your Star Wars Lego collection.  Has many great features including locking S-foils, nice cockpit, cool storage space for Luke's lightsaber (silver hilt!), great landing gear, and astromech socket for faithful Artoo, and customizable decals for either Luke's Red Five fighter or Wedge's Red Three.  Did I mention it comes with six minifigs?!  Included are Luke (pilot, again...) Han in his Hoth gear, Leia in her Hoth gear, Chewbacca, Artoo-Detoo, and Wedge!  Great for escorting you Y-wing on bombing mission or just making that trench run on the Death Star.  

Pros:

6 minifigs!
Great design and color
Nice functions
Customizable
Silver hilt lightsaber
Wedge Antilles!

Cons:

Laser cannons aren't really long enough, but one could probably fix that with the right pieces
No proton torpedoes?

author: guybrush_threepwood2
title: Just like 2003..... except better!
review:
After a while 4502 x-wing gets boring.... there's nothing to do with it except put on and take off the seaweed and recreate dagobah! that's why I was so pleased to get this excellent set. this x-wing is a little different from 4502.... some pieces are missing, some pieces are under different colors (coulors), and some are added!not to mention this one has more mini figs: luke, han, chewie, leia, and WEDGE ANTILEES!!
yes! a real wedge mini! (only one in existence) his helmet is different from the y-wing pilot. and he's very realistic. this set is also great because you can make a fleet with the '07 Y-wing an a base with '07 hoth echo base! I was somewhat surprised to see that Lego asked for sales tax!! yuck! great set and buy it before It's out of stock. but there's always brick link and ebay......   

-guybrush threepwood

author: skybrick25
title: Hey,Luke, May the Force be with you.
review: I got this for christmas, last year, and I have to say It's an amazing set! with greatly realistic wings, infact the whole ship is great. Minifigs: LEGO should have done away with Wedge i mean do you see him alot in the movie? Han solo and chewie are great so is leia, and luke + artoo are great! author: darthvader13
title: The X-Wing just gets better and better
review:
This X-Wing is the jewel to any Lego Star Wars collection. You must have one of these before it is complete. It comes with two pilots, Luke obviously and Wedge Antilles! It also includes Han Solo (Hoth), Princess Leia and Chewbacca. This is a must to any Lego Star Wars fan.

A great thing about the X-Wing is that it comes with wings that can go into attack position and a cargo hold on the underside which is great and adds to the aesthetic design of it. I would definitely give it a 5/5 and it is worth Â£40.00

author: HersheyBearsHockey1938
title: The fighter that killed the Death Star!
review:
Finally LEGO makes the X-wing in perhaps the best form yet! An Empire Strikes Back model of the fighter on Hoth (not quite at the swamp yet) boasts great features which include the S-Foils that open and close with a knob twist, a storage spot and 6 minifigures.

Building the set is easy, takes about 2-3 hours and only has a couple technic sections and four rubber bands for the S-Foils. The only unstable part of the ship are the bottom engines, but it's fairly rare if they fall off at all. Finally Wedge is in a set (after not being included with the first ever X-wing with Biggs which was a mistake) and his pilot helmet looks great, and the face is fine. One of the real problems though was why couldn't Wedge come with his own astromech, R5-G8? R2-D2 can't fly everyone around!

Overall, this set deserved the silent rerelease it got last fall. I actually scored it at my Toys'R'Us last July at $50, and just noticed they raised it to $60. This along with Hoth Base makes for an excellent remake of the movies in a Rebel perspective (which is my own of course). I give it highest marks, especially for the Wedge Antilles minifigure and all the rest of the Rebellion's heroes!

author: Zacherano
title: Phenomenal Set Design and Great Minifigures As Well
review:
I received this set as a generous holiday gift over a year ago, yet I still enjoy tinkering with this quintessential Lego Star War masterpiece, which is truly a wonderful buy for any Star Wars OR Lego fan! After expanding my Lego Star Wars collection with the Death Star, I could not resist requesting this beauty, the classic Star Wars fighter (it does look great on display alongside the Death Star and other classic Star Wars sets). I was immediately more than satisfied with the set after I completed building, which took me maybe an hour to an hour and a half.

Starting with the design of the X-Wing itself, almost no noticeable cons come to mind in the construction and functionality!  First of all, although the wings may be tedious to build and attach to the ship, they are well worth it once you have completed them, as one is easily able to turn the gear to expand and contract the wings for take-off.  This feature is simply a genius maneuver for Lego, part of the reason why this is definitely one of my favorite Lego sets of all time (although perhaps it is a little expensive and the build is slightly long).

The other features of the X-Wing build are simply phenomenal. Once one factors in the space for R2-D2, the cargo hold, and the landing gear which works incredibly well, this is an unforgettable build, and I love the accurate and detailed appearance of the set as well! I think this is really a must-have for any Star Wars fan, and if one has been collecting Lego for a while, this is the set for you.

If you have managed to progress this far in my review, I have to rave about the classic minifigures. In addition to an exclusive Wedge Antilles minifig and a rare Luke Skywalker pilot minifig, this set includes R2-D2 and Chewbacca, as well as rare and exclusive Hoth-oriented versions of both Han Solo (new torso with blue coat and gear), and Princess Leia (winter jacket and insignia), and of course Leia's hairpiece is one of the most valuable and interesting pieces in the set.. Including the extra minifigures, this set is almost worth the price!

Overall, I find it challenging to think beyond the utter streamlined design and beauty of this set, so I deplore you to ignore any reviews that state entirely otherwise. Although there are some minor cons, I highly recommend the X-Wing. Don't forget that this memorable ship destroyed the first Death Star, partly because of its innovative design!

author: skippingboy123
title: The Extemely Fragile X- Wing
review:
Pros
Very nice lego set for show
Come with Chewbacca, Leiah, Luke, A rebel , Han Solo, and R2 D2.
Wings Can move

cons
Fragile 
Should come with CP30
All of the minifigs should come with weapons

I like this lego a lot. Its actually my favorite set right now. But, The first time I built it I put the wings on backwards. When I took them off thw whole thing broke. The wings are connected to the main base. Its really the wings that are so fragile. So I built the wings again making sure to put them on right way. When I went to put on my shelf something broke then another thin broke and then another. The last time I made it I made sure to press the pieces very hard together. Overall it was worth it. Its not overpriced and is not to big but is just right. But on the other hand it was the most frustrating time I have built a lego.

author: minisinger20
title: x-wing
review:

I just got this ship last weekend and I have to say that it was a great buy. A little expensive at $59.99, but it's definitely worth it. Now on to the pros and cons.

author: legoDad42
title: X-Cellent X-Wing!
review:
What a great X-Wing model from Lego. Very nice design. Looks good at all angles. Fun to play with, a sturdy model and of course, the wings open to the X-Wing attack position! 

PRO's - Design, opening hatch for cockpit, compartment for R2-D2, front retractable landing gear, alternate wing details to identify either Luke Skywalker or Wedge Antilles, hatch/compartment underneath to hold a lightsaber and any other hand weapon (I'd say you could hold 2-3 guns w/the lightsaber), hatch to the rear that opens to see a moving gear when you open and close the X-Wings...and finally the best 'pro' on this set...a wheel/gear in the back that cleaverly opens and closes the wings. Looks great in the X-Wing position. Also you get 5 mini-figures(Luke, Wedge, Leia, Han and Chewbacca). 

CON's - Not much, but it would've been nice to have guns for all the mini-figures. Only weapon is Luke's lightsaber. Also, there are 4 small lights to the front of wings. They can fall off. Wish it had a tighter bond, but all the con's are small quibbles. This is a great model. An excellent addition to any Lego collection and lot's of fun to play with! Highly Recommended.

author: SgtSmash
title: A bit pricey, but great nonetheless
review:
While I mostly collect the "City" Legos, I've always been a huge Star Wars fan, and had never purchased a Star Wars Lego set. I guess I'm not one to just display Lego's, and only buy what I can somehow incorporate into the town. But once I learned that Lego will be discontinuing the Star Wars line, I decided now would be the time to get at least some of my favorites from the classic trilogy. 

I bought the X-Wing from Toys R Us, paying about $10 more than I would have had I gone to the Mall Of America Lego store, but these are getting harder to find on the shelf. I couldn't help but feel a bit nostalgic, buying a Star Wars toy many years after collecting the action figures in the late 70's/early 80's. I was a bit surprised that a 350+ piece set would take me over an hour to build, but the first 20 minutes assembling the core of the ship was almost like putting together a Technic set. The gearbox on the inside was cool to put together, and sometimes shake my head in amazement how Lego finds these ways to get things to work. The wings, or course, were repetitive, having 4 of them to assemble. But attaching them to the core was a snap. I found it ingenious of Lego to include small rubber bands to help raise/lower the wings once assembled.

It sure is fun to look at. And although I haven't gone running around the house with it or anything, none of the pieces are loose or jiggly. Luke, R2 and Wedge are the minifigs that best suit this set, with Han, Leia and Chewie being included as toss-ins for price justification. It's not the biggest ship out there, but definitely one of the coolest in the Star Wars saga as well as one of the best Star Wars Lego sets.

author: TangDynasty
title: Re-living a classic...
review:
I remembered watching the first Star Wars movie in the cinema when I was very young then and telling myself that the X-wing must be the coolest plane around! I started Lego pretty late, only like 2 years ago. So it was tough for me and my boys to buy some of the older sets (Ridiculous prices). I was lucky enough to get a set earlier this year in Toy R Us at a decent price. I was overjoyed. My son is very much into the Clone Wards series rather than the original trilogy and was not so sure about the set as he cannot really relate to it. Nevertheless, we had a great time building it! 


 
My quick take

 
Pros

 
- The 6 mini-figs are good additions.
- The full glory of the plane when the wings open.
- Very playable at a good size. (It's one of my son's favourite now)
- No stickers!

 
Cons

 
- The front landing gear is weak. It keeps collapsing if not properly put up. 
- Could have given some weapons for the other min-figs. Probably for Chewie and Han Solo.

 

 
Overall, it is truly a beauty and I am glad to be able to relive my childhood dream with this fighter. The parts are good and the 6 mini-figs are just right. If you can get it at a good price, grab it. You will not be disappointed with this classic.

 
Thanks for reading!

author: pikakong
title: This is the set that sucks me back into the Lego Star Wars endless pit
review:
I haven't collected LSW (lego star wars) since 2001, but this set certainly lures me back into collecting. Seeing this set at the Lego store is all it takes to make me buy this set. It is definitely worth the $50 with all the iconic minifigs (leia, hans, Luke, R2D2, and the extra pilot!), on top of this iconic star wars vehicle!! I think this is a nicer design from the previous X-wing set, even though the previous one has Yoda in it. I am currently trying to find a way to hang it on the wall as a mental-piece-like decoration :)

Pros:

-cool design with open wings mechanism


Cons:
- the wings can be a bit fragile (and the guns too)
-the evil words: special edition/ limited edition



...Y-wing, you're next!

author: Caldlow
title: The X-wing does what it has to do...
review:
Being a playing set:

Because that's what it is in first place. A fairly expensive, fun-to-play-with set. The mechanical system that fold open the wings is fun, it's easy to hold and fly around, and with six minifigures, there are really a lot of options when playing with this set.


Building and instability:

The box and instructions aren't that special. The build isn't either, but it's just so much fun. Seeing how all parts eventually fall into place, and fit together perfectly. The construction isn't too complicated, since it is rather small, so young builders can have some fun too with this set, probably without help. What immeadiately struck me when building was the likeness to the movie-models. LEGO really did a more than great job on the designing part.
The only thing that could be improved is, as much mentioned in other reviews, the front of the landing gear. It is very weak, and the X-wing must be put back very carefully if you don't want it to fall or break off. The wings on the other hand are very sturdy, which surprised me, since they looke rather fragile.

Price, minifigures and finished looks:

This set it very, and with that I mean very expensive. To pay 50 US$ for a ship of about 450 and 6 minifigures is a lot. Yes, the minifigures upped the price a little bit, but this is way too high, and I think LEGO wouldn't lose a lot of income if the lowered the price by at least 10 US$.

And when speaking abut minifigures, six of them come with this set. Two pilots, Han Solo, Chewbacca, R2-D2 and Princess Leia.


The finished set looks good, and even better with the wings opened. It looks almost exactly like in the films, which is very hard to do when you're a designer.


The finish:

This is a great set, if you can afford it. You'll have to be happy and joyful when playing and building, because that's how you morally compensate for the hole in your bank-account.


Caldlow

author: The_Dumb_One
title: My engines are down!
review:
Since the very begining of Lego's Star Wars franchise, an X-Wing fighter has been realesed almost every year. And judging by certain reviews I have read, this is not necesserily the best.

This is the first X-Wing I bought. I rushed home from the local Toy's R Us store on friday after school in great anticipation of the build and play ahead.

The build was fun for the most parts. However, it was very boring having to do 4 wings but I am not complaning because an asymetrical X-Wing would just be wrong.

After having finally completed the four wings, I rushed to get my TIE fighters to have an epic battle, howerver what to my wondering eyes should apear, but when I picked up my X-Wing, the engines fell of. This annoys me to this day and I frequently have to replace them.

When I purchased this set, I already had the first ARC-170 and I was glad to see the return of the wing mechanism, which while slow, works very well (exept when the engines fall of).

All told, this set would get 5/5 if only the engines were attached better, and the price could also be lowered a bit.

author: PaulTR
title: The Best X-wing (So Far:)
review:
Many people (including myself) are guilty of moaning and whining when LEGO remakes the same sets over and over; while it's good to see TLG undoing their past mistakes, there comes a time when it becomes monotonous. However, I can safely say, the 6212 X-wing Fighter is one of the best Star Wars remakes I've ever seen.

 

With its very well-defined color scheme, attention to SW canon, and proper proportions, the 6212 is easily the most accurate looking X-wing set to date. I am very pleased the designers chucked the ugly grey color scheme for a much cleaner approach; the whiteness, along with the Republic Red and liberal use of red parts, makes the set pop out and gives it an "epic" look. Also, unlike some sets, the X-wing is perfectly proportioned for minifigs. In the past, there were complaints that previos X-wing versions sported too-short wings. Not so here! The wings are perfectly canon, and they look simply beastly when locked in "Attack" position. The only downside I can think of as far as looks go is the lasers: The dome-shaped pieces aren't all that accurate. Still, that is a very minor problem in an other-wise gorgeous looking set.

 

The 6212 was a fascinating build. The way the wings are designed to open is ingenius and very creative: A knob on the back controls a gearbox, which in turn cranks two Technic pieces inside the wings to open them. The entire process is kept under steady pressure by rubber bands, which also allow the wings to close. The body of the X-wing is also cleverly designed in an arrow-like shape by using hinge joints to form a point; it is then sturdily attached to the gearbox section. As far as pieces go, the set sports nice amounts of white sloped pieces, useful cockpit/cargo pieces, and some really terrific minifigs. The targeting computer makes a re-appearence in this set (which is a good thing) and you get extra pieces to customize the set to your liking. However, while the pieces are cool, there's really nothing new, so I'd rate the parts as pretty good, but not blow-your-mind good. Furthermore, the Wedge fig is dissapointing considering he was marketed as a "first ever LEGO minifigure". He's just a standard smiley "fleshie" face in Luke's flight suit. Bummer. Also, the absence of C-3P0 is odd; it would have made sense if he was included, as the original cast is pretty much all included, except for him. But hey! That's just me. Overall, the build is very creative and unique, and the useful figs and white parts should come in handy for MOCs.

 

The 6212 is also a joy and pleasure to play with. The wings can be set, the cockpit opens to reveal a targeting computer, R-2 can be removed from his jack, the cargo compartment hinges, and the landing gear folds down. The set also has some fantastic "swooshability", and you can have some great dogfights with the TIE Interceptor set. As for sturdieness, not to fear! This set is solidly built, and will hold up to frequent use, although the cannons may fall off if you get too rough with it (but why would you do that, you LEGO-abuser!? :) The X-wing sports some great figs: Luke, Leia, Han, Chewie, R2, and Wedge. This set is an easy way to pick up most of the essential Original Trilogy characters in their Hoth suits, although I would have prefered the figs in "Episode 4" garb (Tatooine outfit, flight jacket, Aldaraan robes, ect.) Still, it cannot be denied the set is loaded with figs, and you won't be disapointed! As far as value goes, the $50 MSRP may seem a bit too much when you consider the set sports only 437 pieces. However, this point is muted when you see all the rare figs (minus Wedge) you get; it really does make the set worth it. Well, let me finish up with a list!

Pros:

  • -Extremely accurate and proportional
  • -Unique build with very useful parts
  • -Plenty of action features, like opening hatches, wings, gear, ect.
  • -Relatively sturdy
  • -Lots of rare figs
  • -Well-priced, despite low piece count

Cons:

  • -Not many "crazy awesome" pieces
  • -Wedge fig a bummer
  • -Cannons a bit inaccurate
  • -Where's the droid I'm looking for!?

The verdict? The 6212 is easily the best X-wing set so far, and minus my complaints about 3P0, is nearly flawless. Find, buy, build, and enjoy; nuff said!

author: kyloreniscool42
title: Great 2006 Star Wars Set
review:
I got this set for my birthday one year when I  was quite young.  It was a grand surprise for me. It may not hold up nowadays, but it was great when it was released.

Minifigures

This set came with a oddly high number of minifigs. Most of them  are sparsely detailed with just enough for you to recognize them.  The only exception to this is maybe Han Solo. He has a bit more detail in his Hoth outfit.

Completed Model

The star of this set, the X-wing, is okay.  It is inaccurately high off the ground when landed, and shows to many open studs. The model contains to much light gray and tan. Also, the wings take a long time to switch from cruising to attack positions. On the lighter side, the cockpit has a nice printed image of the trench run on a slope. The ship also has a convenient compartment below the cockpit to store Luke's lightsaber. An interesting feature of this set is that the instructions show you how to modify the wings to have the X-wing be Luke Skywalker's or Wedge Antilles's with the parts provided.

Overall

This set is definitely outdated, but it is an easy way to obtain most of the main characters and the iconic X-wing Starfighter. This set was very much worth the price of $49.99.

If it were me, I would buy the new one if you don't have one, but if you do and you're thinking about it, here's a piece of advice: think of detail or feel, as this one feels very Rebellion to me; it's poor-looking (as in money). I highly recommend this set.

author: psychman7
title: Star Wars Set #4: 6212 X-wing Fighter
review:
I got this set for Christmas in 2007 along with #7655 Clone Troopers Battle Pack, #6205 V-wing Fighter, and #7658 Y-wing Fighter. This is a pretty good rendition of the X-wing starfighter we all know and love.

Box/Instructions:
The box is fairly large and has a fantastic design, with what it looks like TIE fighters pursuing it. I found the instructions to be slightly repetitive in the case of the wings. But they are easy to understand and show some very nice techniques, and even divided the model into four sections (not numbered bags); the main body, the wings, and the nose. I always like it when they divide up the model like that.

The Pieces:
There were a good mix of parts, none of them needing stickers (seeing as none of them were included in the set). The most interesting parts of note are the cockpit piece that is used with the metallic patterns, the 2x2 tile plate with the mechanic greebles, the 2x2 slope brick with Rebel targeting computer printing, and the 1x4 tile with the Red Five markings. Other parts of note are the pieces used for the laser barrels. Overall, there is a very good mix of parts used here, and there are some very nice techniques used, especially with the nose.

The Minifigures:
In this set, you get six minifigures; Luke Skywalker, Wedge Antilles, Princess Leia, Chewbacca, Han Solo, and R2-D2. Luke Skywalker is dressed in his pilot attire and has a blue lightsaber. The helmet design and torso design is good. Some back printing would have been nice, though. The shiny chrome lightsaber hilt is nice, although I do think the new silver ones are better. Some may disagree, but that's just me. Wedge Antilles is only unique to this set, and I wish they would release another version of him. I really like his helmet design. Princess Leia is dressed in her Hoth outfit. The Episode IV buns with that outfit...NOT OKAY. That's completely inaccurate to the hairdo she had in The Empire Strikes Back. Chewbacca...not much to say about him. He's the same Chewie that has survived over the years. Han Solo is also dressed in Hoth attire. The torso is well-done, and he looks good, but his character should have included a blaster of something. R2-D2 is just the same one that has been there from the beginning of the Star Wars line. I prefer the newer one, but it's always good to have the classic.

The X-wing:
I like the design of the ship very much. I don't find it nearly as attractive as #9493 X-wing Starfighter from 2012, but it's good. It's the same design as the ship from #4502 X-wing Fighter, with some slight color alterations. But like #4502, it is slightly technicolor, which I don't recall in the actual ship. But the part that #4502 nailed that #6212 did not is the color of the sensory nose. The color in #4502 was a light gray, which is the correct color. #6212 has a white color, which isn't completely right at all. Another thing that bothers me is the length of the laser cannons. They are far too short! The tips don't even look right! The engines in this ship also are way too brick-y. They had the right idea, but they aren't smack in the center of the engine, they are slightly offset. Those are really the biggest flaws, but other than that, the ship looks totally great! The landing gear in the nose is the right height, and the retractable cargo bay is really neat. The main feature, of course, are the S-foil wings. There's a knob at the back that you have to turn in order to open up the wings. That's always a fun feature to have in any version of the X-wing. The original you had to do that manually, of course, but the gear system works so much better.

The Final Verdict:
Pieces - 10/10 - Very interesting parts and MANY printed pieces.
Minifigures - 9/10 - Gotta dock that one point for the wrong hairstyle for Princess Leia.
X-wing - 8/10 - A very well-designed ship, but some movie-accuracy issues I couldn't ignore.

Final result - 9/10. Very much well-done, six minifigures, and lots of printed pieces.
